availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Morrison and Joswell Morrison. Married to Mary Groom Morrison in Clinton County, Kentucky, in May 1852. Father of Benjamin G. Morrison, Clementine Morrison, and Martha J. Morrison. Schoolteacher in Clinton County in 1850. Farmer in Clinton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, District 1, p. 174B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p. 169.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Neatsville, p. 127B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994031, Clinton County Marriages, p. 1.
"William H Morrison (1827-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 23557151, accessed January 24, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23557151.
